title: 114_s1278
content: The "Alaska Outer Continental Shelf Lease Sale Act" authorizes oil and gas lease sales in the Cook Inlet and Beaufort Planning Areas near Alaska. Lease terms for certain Chukchi and Beaufort leases are also specified. The "Alaska Outer Continental Shelf Lease Sale Act" authorizes oil and gas lease sales in the Cook Inlet and Beaufort Planning Areas near Alaska. Lease terms for certain Chukchi and Beaufort leases are extended to 20 years beyond 3 nautical miles of the seaward boundary of the State of Alaska. The Act authorizes oil and gas lease sales in the Cook Inlet and Beaufort Planning Areas near Alaska, extending lease terms for certain Chukchi and Beaufort leases to 20 years beyond 3 nautical miles of the seaward boundary of the State. SEC. 4. DISTRIBUTION OF REVENUE TO ALASKA. Section 9 of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to include a provision for the distribution of revenue to Alaska, specifically defining "coastal political subdivision" and its proximity to the coastal zone. The term "institution of higher education" is defined in section 102 of the Higher Education Act of 1965. The term 'qualified revenues' refers to all revenues from energy development in the Alaska outer Continental Shelf region, excluding revenues from leases subject to section 8(g). 'State' means the State of Alaska, and 'workforce investment board' refers to a State or local board established under subtitle B. For fiscal years 2016-2026, the Secretary will allocate qualified revenues as follows: 50% to the general fund, 27.5% for deficit reduction, 7.5% to the State, 7.5% to coastal political subdivisions, and 2.5% to a special account. The Secretary will allocate 2.5 percent of qualified revenues to a special account in the Treasury for the North Slope Science Initiative and to provide grants for workforce programs in Alaska. In subsequent fiscal years, 2.5 percent of qualified revenues will be allocated to a special account in the Treasury for offshore leasing and development programs in the State, as well as for the development of pipelines to transport oil or gas produced offshore through land under the jurisdiction of the Secretary in the State. For fiscal year 2027 and beyond, the Secretary will allocate 50% of qualified revenues to the general fund, 30% to a special account for State distribution, 12.5% for low-income energy assistance and Arctic infrastructure, and 7.5% to coastal political subdivisions. The Secretary will allocate 90% of funds to coastal political subdivisions based on distance from leased tracts, and 10% equally to those over 200 nautical miles from the tract center, deemed significant for oil and gas staging by Alaska. The Secretary will allocate funds to coastal political subdivisions based on distance from leased tracts, with a portion designated for areas significant for oil and gas staging in Alaska. Amounts required to be deposited for the fiscal year will be made available in the following fiscal year without further appropriation and will remain available until expended. SEC. 5 amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to include 3 lease sales in the Beaufort and Chukchi Planning Areas in each leasing program. SEC. 6 establishes the North Slope Science Initiative. Section 348 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include the Secretary of the Interior, expand areas to include the Beaufort and Chukchi seas, identify development opportunities, and involve additional regional corporations in the Arctic Slope region.
